q: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
h:
“Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Nothing is easier than fault finding.
h:
“Nothing is easier than fault finding.” —
Og Mandino

q: The pen is the tongue of the mind.
h:
“The pen is the tongue of the mind. ” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: You have the ability, now apply yourself.
h:
“You have the ability, now apply yourself.” —
Benjamin Mays

q: Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.
h:
“Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering.
h:
“The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.
h:
“Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.
h:
“What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.” —
Robert Greene

q: If you want more luck, take more chances.
h:
“If you want more luck, take more chances.” —
Brian Tracy

q: When you've got nothing, you've got nothing to lose.
h:
“When you've got nothing, you've got nothing to lose.” —
Bob Dylan

q: The more we value things, the less we value ourselves.
h:
“The more we value things, the less we value ourselves. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Where words fail, music speaks.
h:
“Where words fail, music speaks.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
h:
“A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young.
h:
“Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. ” —
Henry Ford

q: When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing.
h:
“When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing. ” —
Zen Proverb

q: Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.
h:
“Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
h:
“Never was anything great achieved without danger.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.
h:
“I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.” —
Richard Bach

q: Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.
h:
“Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.
h:
“Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.” —
Dalai Lama

q: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
h:
“A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.” —
Osho

q: A good system shortens the road to the goal.
h:
“A good system shortens the road to the goal. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
h:
“We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
h:
“Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: Mind is the creator of everything. You should therefore guide it to create only good.
h:
“Mind is the creator of everything. You should therefore guide it to create only good.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dream.
h:
“If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dream.” —
Les Brown

q: Truth is exact correspondence with reality.
h:
“Truth is exact correspondence with reality. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
h:
“Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.” —
Rumi

q: True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.
h:
“True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.” —
Og Mandino

q: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
h:
“A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him. ” —
David Brinkley

q: I would rather be a little nobody, then to be an evil somebody.
h:
“I would rather be a little nobody, then to be an evil somebody.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: You are not what you think you are, You are not what others think you are, You are what you think others think you are.
h:
“You are not what you think you are, You are not what others think you are, You are what you think others think you are.” —
Unknown

q: A simple rule in dealing with those who are hard to get along with is to remember that this person is striving to assert his superiority; and you must deal with him from that point of view.
h:
“A simple rule in dealing with those who are hard to get along with is to remember that this person is striving to assert his superiority; and you must deal with him from that point of view.” —
Alfred Adler

q: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
h:
“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

q: A good character is the best tombstone. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.
h:
“A good character is the best tombstone. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
h:
“You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.” —
Les Brown

q: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
h:
“The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.” —
Helen Keller

q: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
h:
“Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.” —
Les Brown

q: All that a man achieves and all that he fails to achieve is the direct result of his own thoughts.
h:
“All that a man achieves and all that he fails to achieve is the direct result of his own thoughts.” —
James Allen

q: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
h:
“The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.” —
Zen Proverb

q: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
h:
“The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.” —
Lin Yutang

q: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.
h:
“Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.” —
Og Mandino

q: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
h:
“I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.
h:
“Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.” —
Og Mandino

q: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
h:
“In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.” —
Carl Jung

q: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
h:
“Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Giving is living. If you stop wanting to give, there's nothing more to live for.
h:
“Giving is living. If you stop wanting to give, there's nothing more to live for.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.
h:
“Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves.
h:
“The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves.” —
Pema Chodron

q: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
h:
“If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.” —
Lao Tzu
